channel.title: Compiling–Eclipse
channel.description:
I have a Java Breakout game (the game with the paddle, ball, and bricks to break), but I do not know how to compile it into a file that you can click to run or into a file that you can host on a website. The Java course I took didn't go over compiling in Eclipse, lol. Please help.
TheCyberMan

item.title: Compiling–Eclipse
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

You can right click on your project and click Export. In the Java section, you have options such as ‘Jar File’ and ‘Runnable Jar File.’ I use the Jar File option myself, because it allows you to select which files to add and you can modify the Main-Class attribute of the Manifest on the last page, which allows you to make it executable. The Runnable Jar File option didn’t really work that well for me, but it does allow you to embed any included libraries directly in the jar file (which broke when I tried it, iirc), and also uses a run instance for your application to automatically setup the manifest (which is really nice, since it includes parameters and such).

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling–Eclipse

item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

Google how to jar files? If your learning how to run it from eclipse just click the green arrow that the top middleish.
